title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
hi
I detected some corrosion and liquid, I cleaned it.

PPBUS_G3H = 8.18voltage
PP3V42_G3H = 3.4 Voltage
SMC_RESET_L = 3.3Voltage

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
Do you get 12MHz at Y5110?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
SDA = 0.521
SCL = 0.531
pp5v_s5 = no volt


PM_BATLOW_L: no volt
PS_DSW_PWRGD: no volt
PCH_DSWVRMEN: 3,3V
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.4V
RTC_RESET_L: 3.4V
PCH_INTERVRMEN: 3,3V
PP3V3_S4SW_SNS. : no volt
SMC_PM_G2_EN : no volt

I don't have an oscilloscope right now, I'll be able to measure it later. Is it possible to continue without seeing this signal?

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message: Check its DC voltage at least (Y5110).

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
Y5110 PİN3 : 0.304 VOLT    /  PIN1: 0 

The current drawn by the motherboard is 0.02. In this case, the motherboard does not turn on. I couldn't understand why you asked me if you were getting 12MHz.

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
Because SMC doesn't work without clock signal.
And that seems to be the case here.
Check Y5110 traces and adjacent resistors.

On the good board, DC voltage is 1-1.2V approx...

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
sorry i checked the wrong place

pin 1: 1.1 volt
pin 3 : 1.2 volt  and I checked with oscilloscope now it is 12mhz

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
PP5V_S5 : 0
SMC_PM_G2_EN : 0
SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN : 0

There is a voltage of PPBUS_G3H = 8.18, shouldn't it be 8.58 here? Let's light that green now please :)

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
Which area was affected by liquid spill?
I recommend you to reball SMC.

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
I warmed up the SMC a little and the green light came on and it started to pull to 0.70. now i will do reballing and i will write the result.
thanks :)

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message: Since I couldn't find the stencil, I put a new one. the green light is on, it does not turn orange and the device turns off after it reaches 0.75 amps. I replaced it with another one in case the SMC might be faulty, the result is the same. When I warmed up his own SMC, yesterday the green light was on, then the orange light was on, it was night here, I never continued. I tried 2 new SMCs today and the same thing happened on 2 of them. I noticed the CPU getting a little overheated during boot up

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
New SMC will never work!
SMC must come from donor board; it has specific firmware...

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
I was very surprised, does this apply to all models? No way to run the new SMC? Then why is it being sold? :)
Isn't there a way to send a program to smc?

title: 820-3437-B no green light not charging
message:
Sometime SMC can be reprogrammed.
You can read more about rEFIt.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/SMC_flashing[/URL]
But is not the case here.
